availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Reuben J. McCaslin (Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James McCaslin and Mary McCaslin. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a corporal and first sergeant from July 10, 1861. Reported as deserted in December 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 286A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 98.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0093.
